title: Chana Masala Recipe • Chickpea Curry Recipe • Chole Bhature Recipe • How To Make Chickpeas Recipe
description:
Chana Masala Recipe |  Chickpea Curry Recipe | Chole Bhature Recipe | Chana Recipe | How To Make Chickpeas Recipe | Chole Recipe | Garbanzo Beans Recipe | How To Make Channa Masala | Indian Vegetarian Recipes | Best Vegetarian Curry Recipe | Tasty Chick Pea Curry | Indian Vegan Curry Recipe | Chole Masala Recipe

Quick and simple chana masala recipe. In this video I will show you how to make chana masala curry also known as chickpea curry.

How to make Chana Curry  

With this recipe, you will be able to make a delicious and flavourful Indian chana curry adored by people all over the world. Chana curry, otherwise known as chickpea curry, is a simple curry that with my recipe, can be made any time of the day. This authentic restaurant style Indian curry will ensure that every bite you take is filled with flavour. Enjoy with a myriad of items including paratha, basmati rice and naan. 

Ingredients;

500g Chickpeas (Chana) – leave to soak in water overnight in at least 600ml of water
150 ml Olive Oil 
2 Onions
2 Tomatoes
3 Turmeric Powder (Haldi)
1 tbsp Garlic Paste
1 tsp Chilli Powder
2 tsp Salt
2 tsp Ground Cumin (Jeera)
1 Green Chilli 
Water (from the soaking of the chickpeas)

1. Drain the chickpeas that have been left to soak overnight making sure to keep the water after draining
2. Pour oil in pan and heat for a minute before adding onions
3. When onions have become golden brown, add the chopped tomatoes and allow to soften 
4. Add the turmeric powder, chilli powder, cumin seeds, green chilli and salt, then mix
5. To ensure the mixture does not burn, add 100ml of the water from the water that was drained from the chickpeas 
6. Leave to cook the masala mixture for about 5 minutes, stirring every few minutes
7. Add the chickpeas to the mixture and cook on medium heat for 6-8 minutes
8. Add 500ml water that was drained from the chickpeas into the pan and mix every few so often
9. Cook the curry for approx 45 minutes, if the chickpeas are still hard and the water has evaporated then add more water 
10. When the oil has risen to the top and the chickpeas are soft, this will indicate that the spices are cooked, and the curry is ready to eat
11. Serve warm with paratha!

THANK YOU FOR WATCHING!
